result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dennis Demetrius Carter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dennis Demetrius Carter was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with Huber.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, paid from bail on deposit, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety.

*NO contact with firearms.
*Under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*NO violent contact with Jennifer M.-R., R.R. or A.R.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
*May not co-habitation with Jennifer M.-R. until completion of 8 BIP sessions and has no violations of AODA condition.

*Batterers Intervention Program.
*Mental Health Evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review hearing scheduled for 10/30/15 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Signed and filed:  Decision and Order Denying Request for Bail Refund.  Copy forwarded to the state and defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Victim addressed the court. Received & Filed, 2 letters as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 11 DAYS time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with Jennifer M.-R., R. R. or A. R.
-May not co-habitation with Jennifer M.-R. until completion of 8 BIP sessions, and has had no violations of AODA condition.
-Obtain/maintain employment or school.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, paid from bail on deposit, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.d. 

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter from River's Shore Clinic.
Received & Filed, Jutice Point Report.

Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3rd call of this case. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed. 
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled, 2nd call of the case. Court in receipt of Justice Point Violation Report: Positive Drug Test. Discussion regarding bail, no request to increase bail. Bail remains the same. Parties remain in trial posture. Case passed to 1:30 PM.

Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions & Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM021047  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/18/2015
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, by counsel. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JENNIFER M-R., RANDI R., AND ALEXANDRIA R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dennis Demetrius Carter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
